DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS 43 Adult Profile v2.0 PFA21 Able to Go Up and Down Stairs at a Normal Pace Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of the difficulty they have going up and down stairs at a normal pace, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS-43 Adult Profile v2.0 Ability to Go Up and Down Stairs at a Normal Pace Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 43-item multidimensional and universal measure of health intended for use across a variety of conditions. It measures an adult patient's self-reported health status in seven domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and participation in social roles._A question about the ability of an individual to go up and down stairs at a normal pace._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 43-item multidimensional and universal measure of health intended for use across a variety of conditions. It measures an adult patient's self-reported health status in seven domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and participation in social roles.

Concepts.definition: A 43-item multidimensional and universal measure of health intended for use across a variety of conditions. It measures an adult patient's self-reported health status in seven domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and participation in social roles.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PROMIS Ability Difficulty Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores from 1: Unable to do, to 5: Without any difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something without any difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something without any difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with a little difficulty.

Concepts.longName: Can Do With a Little Difficulty
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with a little difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with some difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with some difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with much difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with much difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are you able to go up and dow
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are you able to go up and down stairs at a normal pace?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for ECOG-ACRIN study in Rave per request by S. Roulliard. mc 5/5/15
